availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Thomas Kinnaird (Warren County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier (Adjutant-11th Ky. Inf.))

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Kinnaird and Dicy Kinnaird. Attended school in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Warren County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as an adjutant from December 9, 1861 to December 17, 1864. Wounded at the Battle of Murfreesboro, Rutherford County, Tennessee, on December 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 578.

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 2.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0248.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 824..
